author: jih2nn
content:
Thanks for the feedback! Using `ExecutionEngine` constant inside `is_inclusion_list_satisfied(store: Store, block_root: Root) -> bool` sounds good. I think this approach better aligns with the spec.

What would be the signature of `on_inclusion_list` in your mind? Based on the suggested test vectors covering IL equivocation, I assume it's `def on_inclusion_list(store: Store, signed_inclusion_list: SignedInclusionList) -> None` in option 3 that calls `store_inclusion_list(store: InclusionListStore, inclusion_list: InclusionList, is_before_view_freeze_deadline: bool) -> None`?

author: m.kalinin
content: I think `on_inclusion_list` can also have an `InclusionListStore` as a param

author: jih2nn
content: Wouldn't it be better to call `get_inclusion_list_store()` inside `on_inclusion_list` just like `is_inclusion_list_satisfied` does?

author: m.kalinin
content: I think in this case it doesn't matter much, `on_inclusion_list` is a handler specific to IL logic and encapsulated in an IL module. It can call `get_inclusion_list_store()` but it is also fine if it has the store as a parameter

author: jih2nn
content: Just to clarify, in here, does `on_inclusion_list` have both FC store and IL store, or just IL store?

author: m.kalinin
content: it should have both, because `Store` is used to compute the time into a slot. Perhaps, it is better to obtain `InclusionListStore` via a method call, then the signature of `on_inclusion_list` will be similar to other event handlers

author: jih2nn
content: Yes and on top of consistent signature, I think having only FC store is better because explicitly obtaining `InclusionListStore` and calling its method gives us clearer separation of the IL module.

author: m.kalinin
content: Right, `on_inclusion_list` handler is already specific to ILs logic, this is why additional separation isn't required IMO. But the unified method signature argument is appealing to me
